page.title: 11FOLKLORE AND LEGEND
page.content:
AT THE BOTTOM OF THE VILLAGE COMMON LAND IS REED'S WELL, SO CALLED BECAUSE OF ONE REED LOSING HIS LIFE NEAR THIS SPOT AS THE RESULT OF A FAMILY FEUD AT THE LOCAL FAIR. BECAUSE OF THIS TRAGEDY THE PEOLE HAVE BEEN DEPRIVED OF HOLDING A FAIR SINCE THEN.
THE LOCAL CROSSROADS ARE KNOWN AS THE PISTOLS BECAUSE THE HIGHWAYMEN USED TO WAIT AND AMBUSH PEOPLE HERE LONG AGO. ONE FARM, WHICH NAMES ALL ITS FIELDS, HAS ONE CALLED DEADRIGG BELIEVED TO BE SO CALLED BECAUSE MANY BODIES FROM THE BATTLE OF FLODDEN WERE BURIED HERE.
